entry.title: Silver (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that on the day of her Silver concert, singer Regine Velasquez (pictured) suffered from a viral infection and temporarily lost her voice?

entry.title: LaDainian Tomlinson (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that LaDainian Tomlinson scored two touchdowns in 47 seconds to break the NFL single-season touchdown record?

entry.title: Capri Sun (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that tobacco conglomerate Philip Morris Cos. marketed Capri Sun to children based on experience selling tobacco to young people?

entry.title: African Civilization Society (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that in the aftermath of the American Civil War, the only Black-led organization providing teachers to formerly enslaved people was the African Civilization Society?

entry.title: Gother Mann (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Gother Mann commanded a small body of militia on Dominica during the French invasion in 1778?

entry.title: Ward v. Flood (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Ward v. Flood was the legal basis for racially segregated education in California?

entry.title: Kenneth Willoughby Heaton (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Kenneth Willoughby Heaton developed the Bristol stool scale for classifying the consistency of human faeces?

entry.title: the smallest TV station in the United States (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Los Angeles Times, the Chicago Tribune, and Sports Illustrated have all profiled the smallest TV station in the United States?
